column2: Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive networks, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them
column5: The target to ensure recharging pools for light-duty vehicles in list A is likely to have a negative impact on the target in list B to reduce the number of Red List species threatened by invasive alien species, as increased infrastructure development can lead to habitat destruction and fragmentation.

column2: By 31 December 2030, along the TEN-T core road network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km between them
column5: The target to ensure recharging pools for heavy-duty electric vehicles in list A is likely to have a negative impact on the target in list B to reduce the negative impacts on sensitive species and habitats, as increased infrastructure development can lead to habitat destruction and fragmentation.

column2: By 31 December 2030, in each safe and secure parking area at least four publicly accessible recharging stations dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an individual power output of at least 100 kW are deployed
column5: The target to ensure recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles in list A is likely to have a negative impact on the target in list B to combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, as increased infrastructure development can lead to land degradation and soil erosion.

column2: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed
column5: The target to ensure recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles in list A is likely to have a negative impact on the target in list B to ensure that incidental catches of sensitive marine species are minimised and where possible eliminated, as increased infrastructure development can lead to habitat destruction and fragmentation.

column2: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall not exceed these limits: 2 % from 1 January 2025, 6 % from 1 January 2030
column5: The target to reduce GHG intensity of ships in list A is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list B to reduce the number of Red List species threatened by invasive alien species, as reduced greenhouse gas emissions can lead to improved air and water quality.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station is deployed in each urban node
column5: The target to deploy hydrogen refuelling stations in list A is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list B to reduce the negative impacts on sensitive species and habitats, as hydrogen fuel cells can provide a cleaner source of energy and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations designed for a minimum cumulative capacity of 1 tonne per day and equipped with at least a 700 bar dispenser are deployed with a maximum distance of 200 km between them along the TEN-T core network
column5: The target to deploy hydrogen refuelling stations in list A is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list B to combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, as hydrogen fuel cells can provide a cleaner source of energy and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029
column5: The target to ensure electricity supply to stationary aircraft in list A is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list B to ensure that incidental catches of sensitive marine species are minimised and where possible eliminated, as reduced greenhouse gas emissions can lead to improved air and water quality.

column2: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025
column5: The target to ensure shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels in list A is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list B to ensure that all harvested stocks are fished at maximum sustainable yield, as reduced greenhouse gas emissions can lead to improved water quality.

column2: Member States shall ensure that a minimum shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is provided in TEN-T maritime ports
column5: The target to ensure shore-side electricity supply to seagoing container ships and passenger ships in list A is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list B to ensure that the condition is known for at least 90% of the area distributed overall habitat types listed in Annex I by 2030, as reduced greenhouse gas emissions can lead to improved air and water quality.

column2: (chapter I - art. 2: subject matter) Member States shall put in place effective and area-based restoration measures with the aim to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems within the scope as defined in Article 2, by 2030, at least 20 % of land areas in need of restoration
column5: The target to restore land areas in list B is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list A to achieve zero-emission cars and lorries, as restored land areas can provide improved ecosystem services and reduced greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: (chapter I - art. 2: subject matter) Member States shall put in place effective and area-based restoration measures with the aim to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems within the scope as defined in Article 2, by 2030, at least 20 % of sea areas in need of restoration
column5: The target to restore sea areas in list B is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list A to achieve zero-emission cars and lorries, as restored sea areas can provide improved biodiversity and ecosystem health.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to improve to good condition areas of habitat types listed in Annex I which are not in good condition
column5: The target to restore habitat types in list B is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list A to achieve zero-emission cars and lorries, as restored habitat types can provide improved biodiversity and ecosystem health.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to re-establish the habitat types listed in Annex I in areas not covered by those habitat types with the aim to reach their favourable reference area
column5: The target to re-establish habitat types in list B is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list A to achieve zero-emission cars and lorries, as re-established habitat types can provide improved biodiversity and ecosystem health.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall put in place the restoration measures for the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of the species listed in Annexes II, IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC and of the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of wild birds covered by Directive 2009/147/EC
column5: The target to restore habitats for species in list B is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list A to achieve zero-emission cars and lorries, as restored habitats can provide improved biodiversity and ecosystem health.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall ensure that the condition is known for at least 90% of area distributed overall habitat types listed in Annex I by 2030 and 100% by 2040
column5: The target to know the condition of habitat types in list B is likely to have a positive impact on the target in list A to achieve zero-emission cars and lorries, as knowing the condition of habitat types can lead to improved biodiversity and ecosystem health.
